ui.item: Chrysler = innovation and creativity
Strategic alliance with FIAT SpA promises world-class technology in small- and medium-size cars
Explore the timeline for stories you can use with customers
• 1924 – Walter P. Chrysler takes his Chrysler Six to New York Auto Show hoping to get funding for production
• Sold 32,000 units – most ever for new American launch
• 1928 – Chrysler acquires Dodge Brothers, Inc. to create “Big Three” U.S. automakers
• Chrysler launches revolutionary aerodynamic, unibody Airflow automobiles, with available automatic overdrive transmission

• First use of safety glass
  • First power-assisted convertible tops
• Chrysler creates formal vehicle parts division, which becomes Mopar
• Chrysler introduces safety rim wheels, all-steel-body station wagon, and key-operated combination ignition/starter
• Mopar becomes a full line of repair and replacement parts for Chrysler vehicles
• Willys Jeep® helps win World War II

Chrysler firsts:
  • Chrysler 300 introduced
  • Hemi V8
  • Four-wheel disc brakes
  • Power windows/Power steering
  • Automatic speed control
• Mopar expands to racing and performance parts
• Dodge establishes itself as the performance brand, ushers in “muscle car” era, dominating NASCAR circuit, bolstered by Mopar performance components.
• Chrysler brand vehicles become known as “Mopars”
• First domestically-produced front-wheel-drive subcompacts launch – Dodge Omni and Plymouth Horizon
• Mopar Direct Connection performance parts line launched
• Chrysler launches the Dodge Caravan and Plymouth Voyager, creating a new market segment – the minivan
• Chrysler acquires American Motors and the Jeep® brand
• Chrysler and Daimler-Benz merge to form DaimlerChrysler Corporation
• Chrysler redefines the minivan with “Swivel ‘n Go” seating and more
• Dodge recreates the “muscle car”
• SRT badge introduced on performance vehicles, becomes marketing brand
• Ram launches a heavy duty truck line
• Chrysler and FIAT partner; company emerges from bankruptcy in just weeks
2011 and Beyond

• Chrysler Group returns to profitability, repays loans in full to Government of Canada and Ontario
  • Launches 17 new/significantly refreshed vehicles to critical acclaim
2011 and Beyond
• FIAT launches FIAT 500 and Abarth models in North America
2011 and Beyond
• Mopar celebrates its 75th anniversary

“I gave the public quality, beauty, speed, comfort, style and power, all at a low price.”
-Walter P. Chrysler
The Chrysler brand is known for innovative engineering and expressive design.
With Dodge, it’s performance all the way… just think HEMI<font face='Superscript'>® </font> power.
The Ram brand speaks volumes about rugged capability and never backing down from a challenge.
Jeep<font face='Subscript'>® </font> vehicles inspire an authentic passion for individuality.
The next wave of Italians has arrived. FIAT brings the best of Italy to America.
SRT – Street and Racing Technology – brings it with a truly exciting driving experience.
The Mopar<font face='Subscript'>® </font> brand is the go-to source for vehicle owners, racers and performance buffs.
Understanding the Chrysler Group brands will help you relate to customers on a more personal level
Select each button to learn more...

• You play a vital role in the total dealership team
• Dealerships include multiple departments and functions
• Each has a role in creating positive customer experiences
Back BluePrint
NEW VEHICLE SALES

• Welcomes new customers into the dealership family
  • Starts the customer relationship in a professional and satisfying manner by identifying and meeting customer new vehicle needs and wants
  • Teams with Service and Parts Departments to transition customers
USED VEHICLE SALES

• Welcomes new customers into the dealership family
  • Starts the customer relationship in a professional and satisfying manner by identifying and meeting customer pre-owned vehicle needs and wants
  • Teams with Service and Parts Departments to transition customers
FINANCE AND INSURANCE

• Administers vehicle financing options
  • Sells Chrysler Service Contracts and other products to meet customer needs and enhance the ownership experience
AFTER SALES

• Several departments working together closely to provide maintenance and repairs
  • Makes a significant contribution to customer satisfaction, loyalty, and dealership profitability
  • Strong relationships lead to repeat customers for service and sales

ui.bodyImage: Service Advisor with customer at Express Lane or tire area

ui.item: • Consistently introducing new/used vehicle customers to Service and Parts
• Informing customers of extended service hours, Express Lane, tire sales
• Referring service customers who may be prospects for a new vehicle
• Consistent customer-focused experiences
• Building customer confidence, trust and loyalty
